page.title: 20BONJEDWARD an ancient place
page.content: {Bonjedward}lies about a mile to the north of Jedburgh,and is said to have been an old{Roman}settlement.The cottage in the "island" of roads is now a{Craft}Centre,but until about 1930 it was a{Smiddy. }Iron rings can still be seen in the wall,and a huge driving wheel in the attic probably drove a wetstone at ground level. {Petrol}was sold at the cottage after the Smiddy closed.The road level was much lower then. The{B.P.Filling Station}is run by Mounthooly Farm using the shop as an outlet for their fresh vegetables with groceries,sweets,frozen foods,cigarets car spares etc.In the summer 34,000 litres of petrol per week are sold with 20,000 in the winter. The busiest day for selling petrol is{Friday,}and{Sunday}is the busiest day for foodstuffs.
